result.execSummary:
The defendant James A Borgealt was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Cash bail applied, fine paid in full.

DNA surcharge paid in full.

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. James A Borgealt

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty. Basil Loeb
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Case called at 11:00 a.m.
Attorney Cristian Woller in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Basil Martin Loeb in court for James A Borgealt.
Defendant James A Borgealt in court. 
Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant.
Counts 1, 2, and 3 are dismissed and read-in.
Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 4.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of Count 4.
State makes sentencing recommendations.
Defense makes sentencing recommendations.
Defendant makes statements.

COUNT 4
Court orders the following:
3-DAYS JAIL
CREDIT TIME 3-DAYS
COURT CONSIDERS TIME SERVED.

Court orders the following:
Fine:  $883.00
Domestic Abuse Surcharge:  $100.00
DNA Sample and Surcharge:  $200.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
*Cash Bail in the amount of $650.00 to be applied to the fine/surcharges*
Balance to be paid in 30-days.
Penalty:  Entry of a Civil Judgment
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

dated 09-14-2022 from Atty. Basil Loeb, requesting to reschedule the 09-22-2022 plea and sentencing hearing.

dated 06-30-2022 from Atty. Basil Loeb, requesting to reschedule the 07-06-2022 hearing;

Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:45 AM   File not called on the record.

Defendant James A Borgealt in court by zoom with attorney Basil Martin Loeb by zoom.
All parties have agreed that some may have the hearing conducted remotely. This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing.
Attorney Loeb requests another hearing date.  Court grants.  Hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.addlTxt: Atty. Eric Raskopf.

Adjustment Number: 22A 011775,
Payable Number: 460800,
Receipt Number: 22R 012332,
Amount: $20.00
Hearing on May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no VIOLENT contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.     Defendant ordered to CAM monitoring through Wisconsin Community Services. CAM duration pursuant to Pretrial Supervision Program protocols. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM testing.  The Defendant to report to WCS within 1 business day of being released.

01:36 PM Defendant James A Borgealt in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern, Taylor Olson.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court. 
NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED BY COURT.
The Court puts the Defendnat on notice that if a WCS non compliance is filed, the Court will issue a warrant.  Hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.
